parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A Galilean, an inhabitant of Galilee. From Galilaia; Galilean or belonging to Galilea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A Galilean, an inhabitant of Galilee. From Galilaia; Galilean or belonging to Galilea.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
